projects.title: Deepfake Detection on Faces in Video
projects.description: Undergraduate thesis project focused on developing a deepfake detection system combining EfficientNet-B1 and Cross-Attention Multi-Scale Vision Transformer. Implemented as a Flask-based web application with interactive upload, detection, and evaluation features.
projects.details: This thesis addresses the growing threat of deepfake technology to digital security. A hybrid architecture was designed, integrating EfficientNet-B1 for feature extraction with a Cross-Attention Multi-Scale Vision Transformer for context modeling. The system was trained on FaceForensics++ and Celeb-DF(v2), and tested on DeepFakeDetection (DFD) to evaluate generalization. The web-based system, built with Flask, allows users to upload videos, analyze them, and view detection results with confidence scores, confusion matrices, and batch evaluation. Results achieved an AUC of 92.35% and a video-level F1-score of 83.62%, while maintaining high computational efficiency (0.349 GFLOPs per frame).

projects.title: Analisis Polarisasi Pemilu 2024 di Media Sosial X
projects.description: Big Data Challenge project from the Satria Data 2024 competition, analyzing polarization in the 2024 Indonesian Presidential Election debates using Social Network Analysis, Topic Modeling, and Aspect-Based Sentiment Analysis with IndoBERT.
projects.details: This project was developed as part of the Satria Data 2024 competition, Big Data Challenge division. It investigates public opinion polarization on media sosial X (Twitter) during the 3rd and 4th presidential debates of Pemilu 2024. It combines Social Network Analysis (SNA), Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) topic modeling, and Aspect-Based Sentiment Analysis (ABSA) to identify influential actors, trending topics, and sentiment distribution across candidates. Results showed strong polarization patterns, with IndoBERT achieving ~82% accuracy in sentiment classification. Insights support political campaign teams in shaping more effective strategies and help the public better understand discourse dynamics.

projects.title: Lit Finder (Bangkit Capstone)
projects.description: Developed the core machine learning recommendation system for a book discovery app, using both Content-Based and Collaborative Filtering techniques.
projects.details: As the Machine Learning engineer responsible for the recommendation system, I preprocessed and merged the Amazon Book Dataset from Kaggle, totaling 174,295 samples. I implemented a Content-Based Filtering model by generating embeddings from book metadata (title, author, genres) and storing them in ChromaDB for efficient similarity searches. Additionally, I developed a Collaborative Filtering model by creating a user-book interaction matrix and using cosine similarity for book recommendations and an SVD model for user-based suggestions. The entire system was served via a RESTful API built with Python and FastAPI, which I then containerized and deployed on Google Cloud Platform.

projects.title: Bank SUMUT Internship: Data Automation & Dashboard
projects.description: Developed a data visualization and automation system during my internship at PT Bank SUMUT. Built dashboards to monitor daily and monthly banking transactions, and automated ETL processes to ensure accurate, real-time reporting.
projects.details: During my internship at Bank SUMUT‚Äôs Operational Division (Electronic Channel), I worked on two main projects: (1) automation of data transformation and loading using UiPath, and (2) creation of interactive dashboards to monitor transaction performance. Initially, I built a prototype dashboard using Python Dash for daily transactions, later revised to Power BI for monthly reporting and richer insights. The Power BI dashboard featured multiple pages, including an overview, transaction types, transfers, bill payments, product payments, and unit performance (branch comparison). I also ensured automation of data pipelines using UiPath to maintain accuracy and efficiency, significantly reducing manual work and human errors. This project improved decision-making for management by enabling real-time, accurate, and visually intuitive data monitoring.

projects.title: Beijing Air Quality Dashboard
projects.description: A data analysis and visualization project on Beijing Air Quality data. It aggregates, cleans, wrangles, and visualizes the dataset to answer key environmental questions.
projects.details: This project analyzes Beijing Air Quality data by aggregating, cleaning, wrangling, and visualizing it in Python. Important exploratory questions include temporal changes in PM2.5 levels, correlations between pollutants, and identifying stations with the highest/lowest pollution. The Streamlit dashboard makes results interactive for end users.

projects.title: Rujak (Rutin Pajak)
projects.description: A web-based solution to simplify and encourage regular tax payments for the community, developed for the Pekan Kreativitas Mahasiswa (PKM) competition.
projects.details: Rujak, or 'Rutin Pajak,' is an innovative solution aimed at making tax payments more engaging and accessible. Built with Laravel and MySQL, the platform was created as part of the Pekan Kreativitas Mahasiswa (PKM) competition. It supports key features such as quiz creation and completion to increase awareness, and a comment section to foster user interaction. My role as Backend Engineer involved database design and implementing core CRUD functionalities while ensuring scalability and maintainability.

projects.title: Thesis Management Website
projects.description: A web-based platform built with Laravel and MySQL to digitalize and streamline the thesis management process for students and faculty.
projects.details: This project was developed as part of a university team assignment for the Database Management course. I led a 6-person team over a 3-month period, overseeing requirements gathering, workflow analysis, and stakeholder engagement. We designed a secure and optimized database system with SQL functions and procedures, ensuring efficient data handling and reducing administrative overhead. I contributed to both backend and frontend development using the Laravel framework, enabling seamless user experience for students, staff, and faculty members. The system supports workflows from initial proposal submission to final defense, making thesis administration more transparent and organized.

projects.details: Demenion (Dementia Companion) is a UX design project developed for the GEMASTIK 2024 competition (UX Design Division, Finalist). It helps caregivers manage the care of people with dementia (ODD) through early detection tools, real-time monitoring with smartwatch and smart tags, and access to resources from Alzheimer‚Äôs Indonesia (ALZI). Key features include health monitoring, fall detection, geofencing, meaningful activities, caregiver community support, and dementia education through webinars and articles. The app achieved an SUS score of 88.75 (Grade A, Excellent), indicating strong usability and user acceptance.
